author: SupraDarky

text: I posted a couple tracks from the first game, a great little game reminiscent of Link's Awakening but still with a uniquely dreamy flavor. I just had to buy Anodyne 2 the moment I saw it on Steam and I'm happy to report that so far, the game exceeds my expectations. The mix of beautiful PS1-3D graphics (only given justice by playing the game) and 2D dungeons keeps things fresh. I also have to mention the soundtrack that instantly gives me Anodyne vibes, which means they have effectively created a franchise that has its own unique feel. This theme was an instant favorite and shows Sean really evolved as a composer when compared to the great but very short Anodyne tracks. The subtle sound of the crashing waves or the high synths starting at 3:00 are great touches that show that extra effort in the soundtrack.
author: SupraDarky

text: I gotta agree with you. I had a playlist and wasn't looking at my phone, this came up and I instantly thought "Yup, this is Anodyne"
